action_title: Thin trees by girdling (cutting rings around tree trunks)
key_messages:
Key Messages:

One before-and-after trial in CanadaÂ found that thinning trees by girdling (cutting rings around tree trunks) increased understory plant species richness, diversity and cover.
background_information:
Background information and definitions:
Girdling, i.e. thinning trees by cutting rings around their trunk, is used as a conservation management practice to increase forest structural diversity. This method imitates the natural death of a tree without using chemicals or cutting trees.
